page.title: 03THE SCHOOL
page.content: Shirwell has its own Primary school which has only 26 pupils - 11 Infant and 15 Junior. The school was almost closed by the County Council in 1983 but parents and other members of the community launched a successful campaign to keep the small school open. It was felt that without the school the community itself would be in danger of losing its identity. The school was made a listed building in 1985 and, as the Head Teacher was at that time in the process of building a new office some difficulties had to be resolved. The building was erected in 1830, commissioned by the Chichester family whose heron crest is to be seen above the main entrance.
